JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr FAC , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , leaving a shop , took a bag belonging to Mr Zh . , who later turned out to be an off - duty police officer . According to the applicant he took the bag because of a misunderstanding . Having seen the applicant leaving with his bag , Mr Zh . caught up with him and asked him if the bag was heavy to carry . Receiving a negative reply from the applicant , PERSON . punched him once in the face . PERSON . later explained to the investigators that when the applicant turned to face him he got the impression that the applicant was going to hit him with a briefcase , and therefore , being in a state of agitation because of the daylight theft of his bag , he had instinctively punched him in the face .
On DATE the applicant went to the doctor who noted split skin on the applicant ’s eyebrow and CARDINAL bruises on his cheek . No other injuries were recorded .
On DATE the Lviv ORG ordered a medical examination of the applicant .

On DATE the medical expert concluded that the applicant had split skin on his left eyebrow measuring CARDINAL by QUANTITY and CARDINAL bruises near the left eye and on the left cheek measuring respectively CARDINAL by QUANTITY and CARDINAL by QUANTITY . The expert classified them as a minor injury .
From DATE the applicant was in a local hospital .

On DATE the same medical expert issued an additional opinion . He took into consideration that on DATE the applicant was admitted to a local hospital , where he had an X - ray examination that showed a fracture of his cheekbone . The expert reported a fracture of the applicant ’s cheekbone and bruises on his face and concluded that the applicant ’s injury fell within the category of medium - level injury
On DATE ORG instituted proceedings against PERSON . for intentional infliction of medium - level bodily harm .

In DATE the investigator in the case ordered a further expert examination of the matter , with a view to resolving the discrepancies between the CARDINAL expert opinions . The examination was conducted by a commission of experts on DATE . The commission , comprising the initial expert and CARDINAL heads of ORG , established on the basis of medical evidence that the applicant had suffered a fracture of the left cheekbone , bruises and concussion . The experts concluded that these injuries amounted to mediumlevel bodily harm with long - term effects on the applicant ’s health .

In DATE a further expert examination of the applicant ’s injury was requested by ORG . DATE and DATE that office conducted complex medical examination of the same medical evidence and did not confirm the fracture of the applicant ’s cheekbone .
Meanwhile , the applicant obtained a number of medical opinions from specialists , who confirmed that he had a cheekbone fracture .

On DATE , relying on the conclusion of the latest medical examination , the investigator decided to terminate the criminal proceedings against Mr Zh . for want of proof of crime ( infliction of medium - level bodily harm ) and because further prosecution ( for infliction of minor bodily injury ) was now time - barred .

By a letter of CARDINAL DATE , the Head of ORG informed the investigator that due to conflicting conclusions on the same X - ray as to the existence or otherwise of the cheekbone fracture a further forensic examination should be conducted .

By a letter of DATE , the Head of ORG asked the investigator for to arrange a visit by the applicant to that office . The applicant arrived in GPE but the examination did not take place , as the applicant refused to be hospitalised for this purpose .
By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Head of ORG invited the applicant to have an X - ray examination in GPE since he had not had CARDINAL in GPE . Apparently , such examination was not carried out .
On DATE ORG closed the criminal proceedings against PERSON . on the same grounds as in the decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG closed the criminal proceedings against PERSON . This decision was quashed by ORG on DATE .
On DATE the criminal proceedings were terminated due to prosecution being time - barred .

By a letter of DATE the Prosecutor General replied to the applicant ’s complaint about the termination of the criminal proceedings . He considered that the decision to terminate the proceedings was well - founded and that PERSON . had been acting as a private person , since he had been in plain clothes , had been off duty and had not identified himself to anyone as a police officer .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint against the prosecutor ’s decision . The court noted in particular that the seriousness of the injuries sustained by the applicant could not be established conclusively because he had flatly refused to have an additional X - ray examination .

On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings in GPE ORG against medical experts and doctors in GPE and GPE , seeking compensation in respect of non - pecuniary damage resulting from their unlawful actions .
On DATE the court found against the applicant , having established that the medical experts and doctors had been acting within their competence .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court .
On DATE the Deputy President of ORG transferred to the President of ORG the applicant ’s request for an extraordinary review of his case . This request was refused on DATE .
On DATE the Deputy President of ORG refused another request by the applicant for an extraordinary review of his case .
